00022 /**
00023  * @file   GcCorrection.h
00024  * @author Vincent Bressler
00025  * @date   Feb 27, 2014
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing an signal intensity correction on all probes based
00028  * on the median intensity of probes with similar GC content.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _GCCR_H_
00031 #define _GCCR_H_
00032 
00033 #include "chipstream/PsBoard.h"

00042 #include <map>

00046 /// String describing gc adjust algorithm/module
00047 #define GCCR "gc-correction"
00048 
00049 /**
00050  *  Class for doing an adjustment based on the median intensity of probes
00051  * with similar GC content.
00052  */
00053 class GcCorrection : public ChipStream {
00054 
00055 public:
00056 
00057   /** Constructor. */
00058   GcCorrection(int algo_rev, bool cel_out, int maxGc=26) {
00059         m_algo_rev = algo_rev;
00060         m_cel_out = cel_out;
00061     m_MaxGc = maxGc;
00062     m_Type = GCCR;
00063     m_ChipCount = 0;
00064     setupSelfDoc(*this);
00065         
00066         m_probe_count_per_gcc = 0;
00067         m_probe_intensities_per_gcc = 0;
00068         m_ChipLayout_obj = 0;
00069   }
00070 
00071   ~GcCorrection ()
00072   {
00073           clear_gcc_arrays ();
00074   }
00075 
00076   void compute_gcc_arrays (std::vector<float>& data);
00077 
00078   void clear_gcc_arrays  (void)
00079   {
00080           if (m_probe_intensities_per_gcc)
00081           {
00082                   for (int i=0; i<=m_MaxGc; i++)
00083                   {
00084                           if (m_probe_intensities_per_gcc[i])
00085                           {
00086                                   delete [] m_probe_intensities_per_gcc[i];
00087                                   m_probe_intensities_per_gcc[i] = 0;
00088                           }
00089                   }
00090 
00091                   m_probe_intensities_per_gcc = 0;
00092           }
00093 
00094           delete [] m_probe_count_per_gcc;
00095           m_probe_count_per_gcc = 0;
00096   }
00097 
00098   /** 
00099    * Caluculates medians for different levels (bins) of GC count
00100    * between 0 and binCount in size and appends to the chipBins. The
00101    * probes vector contains a list of probes that are thought to be
00102    * representative of background at different GC counts. The
00103    * probeGcVec contains the GC count for all probes on the array.
00104    * 
00105    * @param data - One microarray's worth of data.
00106    * @param binCount - Number of bins we are calculating GC content for.
00107    * @param chipBins - Matrix of chip by gc count containing the
00108    * median intensity for a collection of gc background
00109    * probes. Ordering is chipBins[chip][gcCount] and parameters from
00110    * latest chip in data vector will be appended as last row.
00111    * @param probes - Probes to use for estimating background for particular GC bings.
00112    * @param probeGcVec - GC count of every probe on microarray indexed by id.
00113    * @param warnings - Print warnings if a particular bin is empty?
00114    * For example: print a warning if there are no probes in the GC
00115    * count zero bin.
00116    */
00117   static void learnParameters(const std::vector<float> &data, 
00118                               int binCount, 
00119                               std::vector<vector<float> > &chipBins,
00120                               /*std::vector<int> &probes, */
00121                               std::vector<char> &probeGcVec, 
00122                               bool warnings);
00123 
00124   /** 
00125    * Give the background adjusted intensity for a particular probe on a particular chip.
00126    * @param probeIx - Probe of interest.
00127    * @param chipIx - Set of Chips of interest.
00128    * @param intensity - Current set of intensities.
00129    * @param return - background adjusted set of intensities.
00130    */
00131   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity, PsBoard &board) {
00132     return transform(probeIx, chipIx, intensity);
00133   }
00134 
00135   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity);
00136 
00137   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity, int probeGc);
00138 
00139   void transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity);

00149   void newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart);

00151   /** 
00152    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00153    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00154    */
00155   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00156     doc.setDocName(GCCR);
00157     doc.setDocDescription("Correct feature intensity for variations in gc_count.");
00158 
00159     doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00160   }
00161 
00162   /** 
00163    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00164    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00165    */
00166   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00167     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00168 
00169         SelfDoc::Opt algo_rev = {"algo_rev", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "4", "4", "1", "4", "1 - match median gc_count=N intensities to set to median gc_count=12 intensities, 4 - match gc_count=N intensity profile to gc_count=12 intensity profile."};
00170           opts.push_back(algo_rev);
00171 
00172         SelfDoc::Opt cel_out = {"cel_out", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA", "true to create a cel file containing GcCorrected intensities."};
00173         opts.push_back(cel_out);
00174 
00175     return opts;
00176   }
00177 
00178   /** 
00179    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00180    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00181    * @return SelfDoc
00182    */
00183   static SelfDoc explainSelf() { 
00184     SelfDoc doc;
00185     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00186     return doc;
00187   }
00188 
00189   /** 
00190    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00191    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00192    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00193    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00194    * 
00195    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00196    * 
00197    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00198    */
00199   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) 
00200   {
00201         SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00202 
00203         int algo_rev = 4;
00204         bool cel_out = false;
00205   
00206         fillInValue(algo_rev, "algo_rev", param, doc);
00207         fillInValue(cel_out, "cel_out", param, doc);
00208 
00209         GcCorrection *gccorrection = new GcCorrection(algo_rev,cel_out);
00210         return gccorrection;
00211   }

00223   void setProbeGcVec(const std::vector<unsigned char> &vec);

00225   /**

00228    * representative of background binding.
00229    */
00230   void setControlProbes(std::vector<Probe *> &vec);

00232   /** 
00233    * Set the indexes of the probes to use for estimating background.

00237   void setControlProbes(std::vector<int> &vec);

00240    * Setup the background probes and background gc indexes by reading

00242    */
00243   void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00244 
00245 private:
00246 
00247   /// Parameters learned (median of GC background probes).
00248   std::vector<vector<float> > m_Bins;
00249   /// Probe to be used for estimating background median
00250   std::vector<int> m_BgProbes;
00251   /// GC count of each probe matching that above
00252   std::vector<char> m_BgProbeGc;
00253   /// mdsum of probe ids
00254   std::string m_ProbeMd5Sum;
00255   /// How many chips have been seen.
00256   int m_ChipCount;
00257   /// Algorithm revision - valid values are 1 and 4
00258   /// algo_rev = 1 - set the median intensity for each gc count equal to the median intensity of gc count = 12
00259   /// algo_rev = 4 - set the intensity profile for each gc count equal to the intensity profile at gc count = 12 
00260   int m_algo_rev;
00261   /// cel_out - if true, create a cel file containing GcCorrected intensities.
00262   bool m_cel_out;
00263   /// Maximum GC count allowed.
00264   int m_MaxGc;
00265 
00266   int *m_probe_count_per_gcc;
00267   float **m_probe_intensities_per_gcc;
00268 
00269   ChipLayout *m_ChipLayout_obj;
00270 };
